text: Eddy is an unincorporated community in Kay County, Oklahoma, United States. It is 7 miles southwest of Blackwell, Oklahoma.Shirk, George. Oklahoma Place Names. 2nd ed. University of Oklahoma Press: Norman, Oklahoma. 1987, p. 77. The community was originally called Osborne, but its name was changed to Eddy on January 3, 1901. It was named "Eddy" after Ed E. Peckham, who was the son of railroad developer E.L. Peckham. A post office operated in Eddy but closed on February 22, 1957. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Kay County, Oklahoma Category:Unincorporated communities in Oklahoma
title: Eddy, Oklahoma
